Background Check Challenges For Home Health Care Agencies

Law360, New York (April 4, 2016, 10:38 AM ET) -- Home health care is one of the fastest growing industries in the U.S. As the population continues to age, the demand for home health care is expected to increase dramatically. One of the several challenges facing the home health care industry is selecting qualified and trustworthy individuals to provide unsupervised patient care to a vulnerable population.

article_metadata.description: Selecting qualified, trustworthy individuals to provide unsupervised patient care is one of the biggest obstacles facing the home health care industry. And while conducting criminal background checks can be helpful to the process, it also poses risks, meaning agencies must carefully navigate the various federal, state and local laws, as well as regulatory guidance, says Denise Merna Dadika at Epstein Becker & Green PC.
